channel.title: Not compiling
channel.description:
someones still commiting when not compiling im gonna have too go back too version 2 now no ban handler nothing... cmon peeps not that bad too make sure it compiles... i had bad feelings above the cvs in the beginning :(
[code]client.java:2494: non-static method updatePlayer(Player,stream) cannot be refere nced from a static context PlayerHandler.updatePlayer(this, outStream); ^ client.java:2495: non-static method updateNPC(Player,stream) cannot be reference d from a static context PlayerHandler.updateNPC(this, outStream); ^ client.java:2543: non-static method updatePlayer(Player,stream) cannot be refere nced from a static context PlayerHandler.updatePlayer(this, outStream); ^ client.java:2544: non-static method updateNPC(Player,stream) cannot be reference d from a static context PlayerHandler.updateNPC(this, outStream); ^ client.java:6541: non-static variable lastchatid cannot be referenced from a sta tic context outStream.writeDWord(PlayerHandler.lastchatid++); //must be different fo r each message ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 5 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Not compiling
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

And who could that be?

Let’s see, the only people who use the CVS/SVN : mopar, Fasga, Silab, me, and newbiehacker
All of us compile before we commit

This happened because when we reached our upload limit only half the things got commited, hence resulting in compiling errors

Read full topic

item.title: Not compiling
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

because people arnt making sure it compiles before uploading this is more trouble than its worth

Read full topic

item.title: Not compiling
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

What does the CVS have to do with this?

And anyway the CVS is off right now because we reached our limit of 2mb
We are now pending at SourceForge(w00t)

Read full topic
